moves.1. e3 d5 2. h4 e5 3. g3 f5: This defence worked once before, but I suspect it is inherently weak?
moves.4. b3 Be6: Part of the weakness.  the three pawns need suport of the big guns.
moves.8. Nc3 Ne4: Looks cool, but do I have a good attack platform?
moves.9. Qh5+: Outflanked! Can't pull the white Bishop to block as that would leave f5 open to his Queen.
moves.10. Bb5+: This works for me, as I
moves.10... c6: can reinforce d5 and repel the Bishop with c6.
moves.11... Nxc3:
Not an option...

He must have blundered...
moves.13. axb5: His pawn now traps my Knight and Rook.
moves.13... a6: If I had moved to a5, he might have captured in passant.  allowing my rook to escape.
moves.15. Qh5: I don't like my defences.  The three pawns have my power pieces tied up.
moves.15... Rc8: I could get a pawn here.
moves.18. Ng5 Rc5 19. d4 exd4 20. Nf7 Qxf7: I regretted this capture, wishing I had used the bishop.  I had to return the Queen later.
moves.21... Qf6 22. b4 Rxb5 23. Ra4: !?! I'm glad he didn't see he could trade his Queen for 2 Rooks.  (QxR, PxQ, RxR.  I would have been tempted....)
